did.unittitle: Samuel Wagner collection relating to William Wagner and the early years of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Samuel Wagner (1842-1937), nephew of William Wagner, assumed the presidency of the Wagner Free Institute of Science upon his uncle's death in 1885 and served in that role until 1921. From 1921 to 1937 he was President Emeritus of the Institute. Wagner was also a Trustee of the Free Library of Philadelphia and one of the founders of the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

scopecontent.p: This collection is a small assemblage of papers from 1815 to 1905 relating to William Wagner's personal and business affairs and the founding of the Wagner Free Institute of Science, as well as materials relating to Samuel Wagner's archives as Trustee.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
